input: Imagine a self-contained, hypothetical world with only the following conditions, and without any unmentioned factors or causal relationships: Having a sister has a direct effect on tar deposit. Tar deposit has a direct effect on lung cancer. The overall probability of having a sister is 96%. The probability of not having a sister and lung cancer is 1%. The probability of having a sister and lung cancer is 45%. Is the chance of lung cancer smaller when observing having a sister?
